titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: A most beautiful day, warm and spring–like. I wrote letters, read Anglo–Catholic literature, and played bowls with William.

"In this age of the the [sic] world individual greatness and self–action is superseded by routine" â€“ so Newman wrote in 1868, when the principal instruments and occasions of 'hustlement' had not yet come into existence. What could he have said in 1923?
